examples.sentence: Counter System Basics - How counters work

sections.heading: What is 人 (にん/り)?
sections.content:
人 (にん/り) is the counter for people. It's one of the most essential counters in Japanese with special irregular readings for 1 and 2.

1人 = ひとり (not いちにん!) 2人 = ふたり (not ににん!) 3人 = さんにん 4人 = よにん

sections.heading: Complete People Counter Chart
sections.content: | Number | Reading | Romaji | Kanji | | ------ | ----------------- | ------------------- | ----- | | 1 | ひとり | hitori | 一人 | | 2 | ふたり | futari | 二人 | | 3 | さんにん | san-nin | 三人 | | 4 | よにん | yo-nin | 四人 | | 5 | ごにん | go-nin | 五人 | | 6 | ろくにん | roku-nin | 六人 | | 7 | しちにん/ななにん | shichi-nin/nana-nin | 七人 | | 8 | はちにん | hachi-nin | 八人 | | 9 | きゅうにん | kyuu-nin | 九人 | | 10 | じゅうにん | juu-nin | 十人 |

children.heading: Larger Numbers
children.content: 11人 = じゅういちにん 20人 = にじゅうにん 100人 = ひゃくにん 1,000人 = せんにん 10,000人 = いちまんにん

children.heading: ひとり (1 person)
children.content:
The only reading for one person:

一人で行きます "I'll go alone" 一人暮らし "Living alone" 一人っ子 "Only child"

children.heading: ふたり (2 people)
children.content:
The only reading for two people:

二人で食べました "We ate together (two people)" 二人とも "Both people" 二人きり "Just the two of us"

children.heading: Why the Irregularity?
children.content: ひとり and ふたり come from native Japanese, while 3+ use Sino-Japanese numbers. This is a historical remnant.

children.heading: 〜人 + で (together/with)
children.content: 一人で "Alone/by oneself" 二人で "Together (two people)" 三人で行きました "We went (three people together)" 家族5人で住んでいます "We live as a family of 5"

children.heading: 〜人 + が/は (subject marker)
children.content: 3人が来ました "3 people came" 学生が10人います "There are 10 students" 友達が2人います "I have 2 friends"

children.heading: 〜人 + を (object marker)
children.content: 友達を5人招待しました "I invited 5 friends" 3人を選びました "I selected 3 people"

children.heading: 〜人 + の (possessive)
children.content: 3人の学生 "3 students" 二人の子供 "2 children" 5人の友達 "5 friends"

children.heading: 何人 (なんにん)
children.content: 何人いますか？ "How many people are there?" 何人来ますか？ "How many people are coming?" 何人必要ですか？ "How many people are needed?" 何人参加しますか？ "How many people will participate?"

children.heading: 何名 (なんめい) - Polite
children.content:
In formal situations:

何名様ですか？ "How many people?" (polite, at restaurants) ご予約は何名様ですか？ "How many people for the reservation?"

children.heading: Restaurants
children.content: A: 何名様ですか？ "How many people?" B: 4人です "4 people" A: こちらへどうぞ "This way, please"

children.heading: Making Plans
children.content: A: パーティーに何人来ますか？ "How many people are coming to the party?" B: 10人ぐらい来ます "About 10 people are coming" A: じゃあ、食べ物をたくさん用意しないと "Then we need to prepare a lot of food"

children.heading: Family
children.content: A: ご家族は何人ですか？ "How many people are in your family?" B: 4人家族です "We're a family of 4" A: お子さんは？ "Children?" B: 二人います "I have 2"

children.heading: Work/School
children.content: A: チームは何人ですか？ "How many people are on the team?" B: 6人です "6 people" A: それじゃ、ちょうどいいですね "That's just right then"

children.heading: 〜人目 (ordinal)
children.content:
"The Nth person":

一人目 (ひとりめ) - the first person 二人目 (ふたりめ) - the second person 三人目 (さんにんめ) - the third person 彼は3人目の子供です "He's the third child"

children.heading: 〜人ずつ (each/apiece)
children.content: 一人ずつ入ってください "Please enter one person at a time" 二人ずつグループを作ってください "Please make groups of 2" 3人ずつ分かれましょう "Let's divide into groups of 3"

children.heading: 〜人とも (all/both)
children.content: 二人とも来ました "Both people came" 3人とも学生です "All 3 are students" 5人とも合格しました "All 5 passed"

children.heading: 〜人きり (just/only)
children.content: 二人きりで話したい "I want to talk with just the two of us" 一人きりにしないで "Don't leave me alone"

children.heading: 〜人前 (serving/portion)
children.content:
For food servings:

3人前ください "3 servings, please" 一人前の料理 "One serving of food"

children.heading: 名 (めい) - Polite Counter
children.content:
Used in business/formal settings:

参加者は50名です "There are 50 participants" 出席者は何名ですか？ "How many attendees are there?" 5名様でご予約いただいております "We have a reservation for 5 people"

children.heading: 方 (かた) - Honorific
children.content:
Very polite, for guests/customers:

お二方 "Two people" (honorific) 何方様ですか？ "How many people?" (very polite)

children.heading: Living Situations
children.content: 一人暮らし "Living alone" 二人暮らし "Living together (as a couple/two people)" 家族4人で暮らしています "We live as a family of 4"

children.heading: Being Alone
children.content: 一人で大丈夫です "I'm fine alone" 一人でできます "I can do it by myself" 一人じゃない "You're not alone"

children.heading: Group Activities
children.content: 二人で映画を見た "We watched a movie (two of us)" 友達3人で遊びに行った "I went out with 3 friends" クラス全員30人で写真を撮った "All 30 classmates took a photo"

children.heading: Beginning (Emphasis)
children.content: 5人が参加しました "5 people participated" 3人が合格した "3 people passed"

children.heading: Middle (Natural)
children.content: 今日は友達が2人来ます "2 friends are coming today" パーティーに10人招待した "I invited 10 people to the party"

children.heading: End (Count/Total)
children.content: A: 何人いますか？ "How many people are there?" B: 全部で15人です "15 people in total"

children.heading: Age + People
children.content: 20歳の学生が3人います "There are 3 twenty-year-old students" 子供が二人いて、5歳と3歳です "I have 2 children, 5 and 3 years old"

children.heading: Time + People
children.content: 3時間、5人で働きました "5 people worked for 3 hours" 一人30分ずつ話しました "Each person spoke for 30 minutes"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using いちにん for 1 person
children.content: Wrong: いちにん ❌ Right: ひとり ✓ "1 person"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using ににん for 2 people
children.content: Wrong: ににん ❌ Right: ふたり ✓ "2 people"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Wrong reading for 何人
children.content: Wrong: なにじん (this means "what nationality") ❌ Right: なんにん (how many people) ✓ "How many people?"

children.heading: Mistake 4: Forgetting the counter
children.content: Wrong: 友達が3来ました ❌ Right: 友達が3人来ました ✓ "3 friends came"

children.heading: Mistake 5: Using 人 for animals
children.content: Wrong: 犬が2人います ❌ Right: 犬が2匹います ✓ "There are 2 dogs"

children.heading: 何人 (なにじん) - "What nationality?"
children.content: あなたは何人ですか？ (なにじん) "What nationality are you?" 私はアメリカ人です "I'm American"

children.heading: 何人 (なんにん) - "How many people?"
children.content:
何人いますか？ (なんにん) "How many people are there?" 5人います "There are 5 people"

Context usually makes it clear which is meant!

children.heading: Casual
children.content: 何人？ "How many people?" 二人で行く "Going with 2 people" 友達3人 "3 friends"

children.heading: Polite
children.content: 何人いらっしゃいますか？ "How many people are there?" (honorific) お二人でいらっしゃいますか？ "Are you two coming?"

children.heading: Formal/Business
children.content: 何名様でしょうか？ "How many people?" (very polite) 参加者は50名でございます "There are 50 participants"

children.heading: Example 1: Restaurant Reservation
children.content: A: ご予約のお電話ありがとうございます "Thank you for calling for a reservation" B: 明日の7時、4人で予約したいです "I'd like to make a reservation for 4 people at 7pm tomorrow" A: 4名様ですね。お名前をお願いします "4 people. Your name, please?"

children.heading: Example 2: Group Project
children.content: A: このプロジェクトは何人でやりますか？ "How many people will work on this project?" B: 5人のチームです "It's a team of 5" A: じゃあ、一人ずつ役割を決めましょう "Then let's decide roles one person at a time"

children.heading: Example 3: Party Planning
children.content: A: 誕生日パーティーに何人呼ぶ？ "How many people will you invite to the birthday party?" B: 友達を10人ぐらい "About 10 friends" A: 家族も入れたら全部で何人？ "Including family, how many in total?" B: 全部で15人ぐらいかな "About 15 in total"

children.heading: Example 4: Travel
children.content: A: 旅行は何人で行きますか？ "How many people are going on the trip?" B: 友達と二人で行きます "I'm going with a friend (2 people)" A: いいですね！楽しんでください "That's nice! Have fun!"

children.heading: Family Members
children.content: 一人っ子 (ひとりっこ) "Only child" 二人兄弟 (ふたりきょうだい) "Two siblings" 三人家族 (さんにんかぞく) "Family of 3" 4人兄弟 (よにんきょうだい) "Four siblings"

children.heading: Group Terms
children.content: 一人一人 (ひとりひとり) "Each and every person" 二人三脚 (ににんさんきゃく) "Three-legged race" (idiom: working together) 十人十色 (じゅうにんといろ) "To each their own" (lit: 10 people, 10 colors)

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 友達が3人来ました "3 friends came" クラスに学生が20人います "There are 20 students in the class" 一人で住んでいます "I live alone"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: パーティーに何人招待しましたか？ "How many people did you invite to the party?" 二人で映画を見に行きませんか？ "Shall we go see a movie together?" チームは5人です "The team has 5 people"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: この会議には何名出席されますか？ "How many people will attend this meeting?" 参加者が100人を超えました "The number of participants exceeded 100" 一人一人の意見を聞きたいと思います "I'd like to hear each person's opinion"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: Counter System Basics - How counters work Number System Overview - Japanese numbers 何 (nani/nan) - What/how many 家族 (kazoku) - Family terms で particle - Together/by means of Quantity expressions - Expressing amounts Polite expressions - Formal language
